intro: Trachoma sinapicolor, commonly known as the red-flowered trachoma, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
